cards.name: Breath of Life
cards.text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
cards.originalText: Return target creature card from your graveyard to play.

cards.name: Wind Drake
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor:
"No bird soars too high, if he soars with his own wings."
—William Blake,
The Marriage of Heaven and Hell

cards.name: Wild Griffin
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor: Two little goblins, out in the sun. Down came a griffin, and then there was one.

cards.name: Knight Errant
cards.flavor:
". . . Before honor is humility."
—The Bible, Proverbs 15:33

cards.name: Eager Cadet
cards.flavor: The enthusiasm of the young, sharpened by the discipline of a soldier.

cards.name: Angelic Blessing
cards.text: Target creature gets +3/+3 and gains flying until end of turn. (It can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
cards.flavor: Only the warrior who can admit mortal weakness will be bolstered by immortal strength.
cards.originalText: Target creature gets +3/+3 and gains flying until end of turn.

cards.name: Giant Octopus
cards.flavor: At the sight of the thing the calamari vendor's eyes went wide, but from fear or avarice none could tell.

cards.name: Merfolk of the Pearl Trident
cards.flavor: Are merfolk humans with fins, or are humans merfolk with feet?

cards.name: Royal Falcon
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor: Hunter by instinct, weapon by training.

cards.name: Sea Eagle
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor: Where air meets water, fish meets talon.

cards.name: Time Ebb
cards.text: Put target creature on top of its owner's library.
cards.flavor: Like the tide, time both ebbs and flows.
cards.originalText: Put target creature on top of its owner's library.

cards.name: Vizzerdrix
cards.flavor: Its swamp cousin may be meaner, but the vizzerdrix is much bigger.

cards.name: Monstrous Growth
cards.text: Target creature gets +4/+4 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: The nightstalkers' little game of tease-the-squirrel suddenly took an unexpected turn.
cards.originalText: Target creature gets +4/+4 until end of turn.

cards.name: Ogre Warrior
cards.flavor: Assault and battery included.

cards.name: Coercion
cards.text: Target opponent reveals their hand. You choose a card from it. That player discards that card.
cards.flavor:
A rhino's bargain
—Femeref expression meaning
"a situation with no choices"
cards.originalText: Look at target player's hand and choose a card from it. That player discards that card.

cards.name: Willow Elf
cards.flavor: The forest lives in the elf as the elf lives in the forest.

cards.name: Moon Sprite
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor:
"I am that merry wanderer of the night."
—William Shakespeare,
A Midsummer Night's Dream

cards.name: Goblin Hero
cards.flavor:
"When you're a goblin, you don't have to step forward to be a hero—everyone else just has to step back"
—Biggum Flodrot, goblin veteran

cards.name: Scathe Zombies
cards.flavor:
"They groaned, they stirred, they all uprose,
Nor spake, nor moved their eyes;
It had been strange, even in a dream,
To have seen those dead men rise."
—Samuel Coleridge,
"The Rime of the Ancient Mariner"

cards.name: Lava Axe
cards.text: Lava Axe deals 5 damage to target player or planeswalker.
cards.flavor: Meant to cut through the body and burn straight to the soul.
cards.originalText: Lava Axe deals 5 damage to target opponent.

cards.name: Hand of Death
cards.text: Destroy target nonblack creature.
cards.flavor: The touch of death is never gentle.

cards.name: Mons's Goblin Raiders
cards.flavor: Just because they have a club doesn't mean they're organized.

cards.name: Bog Imp
cards.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
cards.flavor: Don't be fooled by their looks. Think of them as little knives with wings.

cards.name: Durkwood Boars
cards.flavor:
"And the unclean spirits went out, and entered the swine: and the herd ran violently . . . ."
—The Bible, Mark 5:13

cards.name: Trained Orgg
cards.flavor: All orggs know how to kill; training teaches them what to kill.

cards.name: Spined Wurm
cards.flavor:
"As it moved, the wurm's spines gathered up bits of flowstone, which took the shapes of dead villagers' heads. Each head spoke a single sound, but if taken together, they said, 'Alas for the living.'"
—Dal myth of the wurm

cards.name: Stone Rain
cards.text: Destroy target land.

cards.name: Armored Pegasus
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor: Asked how it survived a run-in with a bog imp, the pegasus just shook its mane and burped.

cards.name: Python
cards.flavor:
"How can you claim the gods are merciless when they robbed the snake of its limbs to give the other creatures a sporting chance?"
—Hakim, Loreweaver

cards.name: Disenchant
cards.text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.

rulings.text: This is not modal. If the target changes from an artifact to an enchantment or vice versa, this still destroys it.

cards.name: Shock
cards.text: Shock deals 2 damage to any target.
cards.flavor:
Lightning tethers souls to the world.
—Kor saying
cards.originalText: Shock deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Giant Growth
cards.text: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.
cards.originalText: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

cards.name: Counterspell
cards.text: Counter target spell.

cards.name: Terror
cards.text: Destroy target nonartifact, nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.
cards.originalText: Destroy target nonartifact, nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.

cards.name: Prodigal Sorcerer
cards.text: {T}: Prodigal Sorcerer deals 1 damage to any target.
cards.flavor: Occasionally members of the Institute of Arcane Study acquire a taste for worldly pleasures. Seldom do they have trouble finding employment.
cards.originalText: {T}: Prodigal Sorcerer deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Drudge Skeletons
cards.text: {B}: Regenerate Drudge Skeletons. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)
cards.flavor:
"The dead make good soldiers. They can't disobey orders, they never surrender, and they don't stop fighting when a random body part falls off."
—Nevinyrral, Necromancer's Handbook

cards.name: Llanowar Elves
cards.text: {T}: Add {G}.
cards.flavor:
One bone broken for every twig snapped underfoot.
—Llanowar penalty for trespassing

cards.name: Flight
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has flying.

cards.name: Flame Spirit
cards.text: {R}: Flame Spirit gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"The spirit of the flame is the spirit of change."
—Lovisa Coldeyes,
Balduvian chieftain
cards.originalText: {R}: Flame Spirit gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Obsianus Golem
cards.flavor:
"The foot stone is connected to the ankle stone, the ankle stone is connected to the leg stone . . . ."
—"Song of the Artificer"

cards.name: Rod of Ruin
cards.text: {3}, {T}: Rod of Ruin deals 1 damage to any target.
cards.originalText: {3}, {T}: Rod of Ruin deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Orcish Oriflamme
cards.text: Attacking creatures you control get +1/+0.

cards.name: Rhox
cards.text:
You may have Rhox assign its combat damage as though it weren't blocked.
{2}{G}: Regenerate Rhox. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)

rulings.text: You can decide to assign damage to the defending player or planeswalker even if the blocking creature has protection from green or damage preventing effects on it.

When assigning combat damage, you choose whether you want to assign all damage to blocking creatures, or if you want to assign all of it to the player or planeswalker this creature is attacking. You can't split the damage assignment between them.
If blocked by a creature with banding, the defending player decides whether or not the damage is assigned "as though it weren't blocked".

cards.originalText:
You may have Rhox deal combat damage to defending player as though it weren't blocked.
{2}{G}: Regenerate Rhox.

cards.name: Venerable Monk
cards.text: When Venerable Monk enters the battlefield, you gain 2 life.
cards.flavor: His presence brings not only a strong arm but also renewed hope.
cards.originalText: When Venerable Monk comes into play, you gain 2 life.

cards.name: Inspiration
cards.text: Target player draws two cards.
cards.flavor:
"Madness and genius are separated only by degrees of success."
—Sidar Jabari

cards.name: Samite Healer
cards.text: {T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn.
cards.flavor: Healers ultimately acquire the divine gifts of spiritual and physical wholeness. The most devout are also granted the ability to pass physical wholeness on to others.
cards.originalText: {T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.

cards.name: Hero's Resolve
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+5.
cards.flavor:
"Destiny, chance, fate, fortune—they're all just ways of claiming your successes without claiming your failures."
—Gerrard of the Weatherlight

cards.name: Soul Net
cards.text: Whenever a creature dies, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.

rulings.text: If animated so it is a creature, it can be triggered off its own destruction.

cards.originalText: Whenever a creature is put into a graveyard from play, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.

cards.name: Angel of Serenity
cards.text:
Flying
When Angel of Serenity enters the battlefield, you may exile up to three other target creatures from the battlefield and/or creature cards from graveyards.
When Angel of Serenity leaves the battlefield, return the exiled cards to their owners' hands.

rulings.text: If Angel of Serenity leaves the battlefield before its enters-the-battlefield ability has resolved, its leaves-the-battlefield ability will trigger and do nothing. Then the enters-the-battlefield ability will resolve and exile the targeted creatures and/or creature cards indefinitely.
You choose up to three total targets from among other creatures on the battlefield and creature cards in graveyards. You may choose zero targets.
You choose the targets as part of putting the enters-the-battlefield trigger on the stack. Because that ability includes "you may," you choose whether to exile the targets when the ability resolves.

If a creature targeted by the enters-the-battlefield ability dies before that ability resolves, it will become an illegal target even though it may be a creature card in a graveyard when the ability resolves. It won't be exiled.

cards.originalText:
Flying
When Angel of Serenity enters the battlefield, you may exile up to three other target creatures from the battlefield and/or creature cards from graveyards.
When Angel of Serenity leaves the battlefield, return the exiled cards to their owners' hands.

cards.name: Armory Guard
cards.text: Armory Guard has vigilance as long as you control a Gate.
cards.flavor: The Dimir agents watched from the shadows. "Eight hours, and I've yet to see him blink," Nefara hissed. "I suggest we find another way in."

rulings.text: Vigilance only matters when Armory Guard is being declared as an attacking creature. If Armory Guard is already attacking, losing control of your only Gate won't cause Armory Guard to become tapped or to leave combat.

cards.originalText: Armory Guard has vigilance as long as you control a Gate.

cards.name: Arrest
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack or block, and its activated abilities can't be activated.
cards.flavor:
"We will prove your guilt. We don't arrest the innocent, you know."
—Arrester Lavinia, Tenth Precinct

rulings.text: Activated abilities contain a colon. They're generally written "[Cost]: [Effect]." Some keywords are activated abilities and will have colons in their reminder text.

cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack or block, and its activated abilities can't be activated.

cards.name: Avenging Arrow
cards.text: Destroy target creature that dealt damage this turn.
cards.flavor:
"Forgive the theft. Punish the deception."
—Alcarus, Selesnya archer

rulings.text: It doesn't matter what the creature dealt damage to. If the creature dealt damage to another creature or a planeswalker, it doesn't matter whether that creature or planeswalker is still on the battlefield.
Avenging Arrow doesn't affect the damage the creature dealt. It isn't retroactively prevented.

cards.originalText: Destroy target creature that dealt damage this turn.

cards.name: Azorius Arrester
cards.text: When Azorius Arrester enters the battlefield, detain target creature an opponent controls. (Until your next turn, that creature can't attack or block and its activated abilities can't be activated.)
cards.flavor: "You have the right to remain silent. Mostly because I tire of your excuses."

rulings.text: Activated abilities include a colon and are written in the form "[cost]: [effect]." No one can activate any activated abilities, including mana abilities, of a detained permanent.
The static abilities of a detained permanent still apply. The triggered abilities of a detained permanent can still trigger.
If a creature is already attacking or blocking when it's detained, it won't be removed from combat. It will continue to attack or block.
If a permanent's activated ability is on the stack when that permanent is detained, the ability will be unaffected.
If a noncreature permanent is detained and later turns into a creature, it won't be able to attack or block.

When a player leaves a multiplayer game, any continuous effects with durations that last until that player's next turn or until a specific point in that turn will last until that turn would have begun. They neither expire immediately nor last indefinitely.

cards.originalText: When Azorius Arrester enters the battlefield, detain target creature an opponent controls. (Until your next turn, that creature can't attack or block and its activated abilities can't be activated.)

cards.name: Azorius Justiciar
cards.text: When Azorius Justiciar enters the battlefield, detain up to two target creatures your opponents control. (Until your next turn, those creatures can't attack or block and their activated abilities can't be activated.)
cards.flavor: "Your potential to commit a crime warrants further investigation."

rulings.text: The two creatures can be controlled by the same opponent or by different opponents.
Activated abilities include a colon and are written in the form "[cost]: [effect]." No one can activate any activated abilities, including mana abilities, of a detained permanent.
The static abilities of a detained permanent still apply. The triggered abilities of a detained permanent can still trigger.
If a creature is already attacking or blocking when it's detained, it won't be removed from combat. It will continue to attack or block.
If a permanent's activated ability is on the stack when that permanent is detained, the ability will be unaffected.
If a noncreature permanent is detained and later turns into a creature, it won't be able to attack or block.

When a player leaves a multiplayer game, any continuous effects with durations that last until that player's next turn or until a specific point in that turn will last until that turn would have begun. They neither expire immediately nor last indefinitely.

foreignNames.name: アゾリウスの大司法官

cards.originalText: When Azorius Justiciar enters the battlefield, detain up to two target creatures your opponents control. (Until your next turn, those creatures can't attack or block and their activated abilities can't be activated.)

cards.name: Bazaar Krovod
cards.text: Whenever Bazaar Krovod attacks, another target attacking creature gets +0/+2 until end of turn. Untap that creature.
cards.flavor: The Hauler's Collective wields great influence over the Ravnican merchant class. Without it, little moves in the city.

rulings.text: Bazaar Krovod's ability can target an attacking creature that's untapped (such as one with vigilance).
Untapping an attacking creature doesn't cause it to stop attacking or remove it from combat.

cards.originalText: Whenever Bazaar Krovod attacks, another target attacking creature gets +0/+2 until end of turn. Untap that creature.

cards.name: Concordia Pegasus
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor:
"A kick from its hooves is like a bolt of lightning. I'd know. I've been hit by both."
—Rencz, Izzet chemister's aide

cards.name: Ethereal Armor
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 for each enchantment you control and has first strike.
cards.flavor: Metal is scarce, smiths are pricey, and plate mail is heavy.

rulings.text: Ethereal Armor counts each enchantment you control, including itself and any Auras you control attached to an opponent or to permanents controlled by an opponent.

cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 for each enchantment you control and has first strike.

cards.name: Eyes in the Skies
cards.text: Create a 1/1 white Bird creature token with flying, then populate. (Create a token that's a copy of a creature token you control.)
cards.flavor:
"What root and branch cannot reach, our winged friends will attend to."
—Zunak, Selesnya strategist

rulings.text: You can choose any creature token you control for populate. If a spell or ability puts a token onto the battlefield under your control and then instructs you to populate (as Coursers' Accord does), you may choose to copy the token you just created, or you may choose to copy another creature token you control.
If you choose to copy a creature token that's a copy of another creature, the new creature token will copy the characteristics of whatever the original token is copying.
The new creature token copies the characteristics of the original token as stated by the effect that put the original token onto the battlefield.

The new token doesn't copy whether the original token is tapped or untapped, whether it has any counters on it or Auras and Equipment attached to it, or any noncopy effects that have changed its power, toughness, color, and so on.
Any "as [this creature] enters the battlefield" or "[this creature] enters the battlefield with" abilities of the new token will work.
If you control no creature tokens when you populate, nothing will happen.

cards.originalText: Put a 1/1 white Bird creature token with flying onto the battlefield, then populate. (Put a token onto the battlefield that's a copy of a creature token you control.)

cards.name: Fencing Ace
cards.text: Double strike (This creature deals both first-strike and regular combat damage.)
cards.flavor: His prowess gives the guildless hope that they can hold out against tyranny.
cards.originalText: Double strike (This creature deals both first-strike and regular combat damage.)

cards.name: Keening Apparition
cards.text: Sacrifice Keening Apparition: Destroy target enchantment.
cards.flavor: Some souls are too damaged to be of use to the Orzhov.
cards.originalText: Sacrifice Keening Apparition: Destroy target enchantment.

cards.name: Knightly Valor
cards.text:
Enchant creature
When Knightly Valor enters the battlefield, create a 2/2 white Knight creature token with vigilance. (Attacking doesn't cause it to tap.)
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and has vigilance.

rulings.text: You need a creature for Knightly Valor to target as you cast it. There's no way to have it enter the battlefield attached to the Knight token it'll create.
If the creature this Aura would enchant is an illegal target by the time Knightly Valor tries to resolve, the Aura spell doesn't resolve. It won't enter the battlefield, so its ability won't trigger.

cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
When Knightly Valor enters the battlefield, put a 2/2 white Knight creature token with vigilance onto the battlefield.
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and has vigilance.

cards.name: Martial Law
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, detain target creature an opponent controls. (Until your next turn, that creature can't attack or block and its activated abilities can't be activated.)
cards.flavor:
"The good of society matters much more than the inconvenience of a few."
—Agmand Sarv, Azorius hussar

rulings.text: Activated abilities include a colon and are written in the form "[cost]: [effect]." No one can activate any activated abilities, including mana abilities, of a detained permanent.
The static abilities of a detained permanent still apply. The triggered abilities of a detained permanent can still trigger.
If a creature is already attacking or blocking when it's detained, it won't be removed from combat. It will continue to attack or block.
If a permanent's activated ability is on the stack when that permanent is detained, the ability will be unaffected.
If a noncreature permanent is detained and later turns into a creature, it won't be able to attack or block.

When a player leaves a multiplayer game, any continuous effects with durations that last until that player's next turn or until a specific point in that turn will last until that turn would have begun. They neither expire immediately nor last indefinitely.

cards.originalText: At the beginning of your upkeep, detain target creature an opponent controls. (Until your next turn, that creature can't attack or block and its activated abilities can't be activated.)

cards.name: Palisade Giant
cards.text: All damage that would be dealt to you or another permanent you control is dealt to Palisade Giant instead.
cards.flavor: Refusing guild allegiances, she fights for those who can't protect themselves.

rulings.text: Applying this redirection effect doesn't change whether the damage is combat damage.

If you control more than one Palisade Giant, you choose which redirection effect to apply. You can't divide damage dealt by one source. For example, if an attacking creature would deal 8 damage to you and you control two Palisade Giants, you may have that damage dealt to either of the Palisade Giants. You can't have 4 damage dealt to each Giant or choose to have the 8 damage dealt to you.

cards.originalText: All damage that would be dealt to you or another permanent you control is dealt to Palisade Giant instead.

cards.name: Phantom General
cards.text: Creature tokens you control get +1/+1.
cards.flavor: After his death, the general was reunited with fallen soldiers from over thirty of his campaigns.

rulings.text: A creature token that's a copy of a nontoken creature is still a token. It will get +1/+1, but the original nontoken creature will not.

cards.name: Precinct Captain
cards.text:
First strike
Whenever Precinct Captain deals combat damage to a player, create a 1/1 white Soldier creature token.
cards.flavor: "In troubled times, we all need someone to watch our back."
cards.originalText:
First strike
Whenever Precinct Captain deals combat damage to a player, put a 1/1 white Soldier creature token onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Rest in Peace
cards.text:
When Rest in Peace enters the battlefield, exile all cards from all graveyards.
If a card or token would be put into a graveyard from anywhere, exile it instead.
cards.flavor: Some corpses the Golgari cannot claim. Some souls the Orzhov cannot shackle.

rulings.text: While Rest in Peace is on the battlefield, abilities that trigger whenever a creature dies won't trigger because cards and tokens are never put into a player's graveyard.
If Rest in Peace is destroyed by a spell, Rest in Peace will be exiled and then the spell will be put into its owner's graveyard.

If a card is discarded while Rest in Peace is on the battlefield, abilities that function when a card is discarded (such as madness) still work, even though that card never reaches a graveyard. In addition, spells or abilities that check the characteristics of a discarded card (such as Chandra Ablaze's first ability) can find that card in exile.

cards.originalText:
When Rest in Peace enters the battlefield, exile all cards from all graveyards.
If a card or token would be put into a graveyard from anywhere, exile it instead.

cards.name: Rootborn Defenses
cards.text: Populate. Creatures you control gain indestructible until end of turn. (To populate, create a token that's a copy of a creature token you control.)

rulings.text: You can choose any creature token you control for populate. If a spell or ability puts a token onto the battlefield under your control and then instructs you to populate (as Coursers' Accord does), you may choose to copy the token you just created, or you may choose to copy another creature token you control.
If you choose to copy a creature token that's a copy of another creature, the new creature token will copy the characteristics of whatever the original token is copying.
The new creature token copies the characteristics of the original token as stated by the effect that put the original token onto the battlefield.

The new token doesn't copy whether the original token is tapped or untapped, whether it has any counters on it or Auras and Equipment attached to it, or any noncopy effects that have changed its power, toughness, color, and so on.
Any "as [this creature] enters the battlefield" or "[this creature] enters the battlefield with" abilities of the new token will work.
If you control no creature tokens when you populate, nothing will happen.

Rootborn Defenses affects only creatures you control after populating at the time it resolves. The creature token you create will gain indestructible, but creatures you begin to control later in the turn will not.

cards.originalText: Populate. Creatures you control are indestructible this turn. (To populate, put a token onto the battlefield that's a copy of a creature token you control. Damage and effects that say "destroy" don't destroy indestructible creatures.)

cards.name: Security Blockade
cards.text:
Enchant land
When Security Blockade enters the battlefield, create a 2/2 white Knight creature token with vigilance.
Enchanted land has "{T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to you this turn."

rulings.text: You must target a land to cast Security Blockade. If that land is an illegal target when Security Blockade tries to resolve, it won't resolve and won't enter the battlefield. You won't get the Knight token.

cards.originalText:
Enchant land
When Security Blockade enters the battlefield, put a 2/2 white Knight creature token with vigilance onto the battlefield.
Enchanted land has "{T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to you this turn."

cards.name: Selesnya Sentry
cards.text: {5}{G}: Regenerate Selesnya Sentry.
cards.flavor: Ravnicans still tell tales about the Battle of Sumala where four Selesnya sentries held off an entire clan of Gruul warriors.

cards.name: Seller of Songbirds
cards.text: When Seller of Songbirds enters the battlefield, create a 1/1 white Bird creature token with flying.
cards.flavor:
"Lady Wren is the one merchant in Keyhole Downs who isn't running a scam."
—Mirela, Azorius hussar
cards.originalText: When Seller of Songbirds enters the battlefield, put a 1/1 white Bird creature token with flying onto the battlefield.
